item.name: Search - Results - By Query ID

request.description:
### Endpoint Description: Search - Results - By Query ID

- **Name**: Search - Results - By Query ID
  - This is the title of the API request, which indicates its functionality related to fetching search results based on a specific Query ID.

- **Request**: 
  - Contains all the details needed to execute the API call.

  - **Auth**: 
    - Specifies the authentication method used for the API request.
    
    - **Type**: 
      - The type of authentication used, which in this case is Bearer.
      
    - **Bearer**: 
      - This is an array containing the information for bearer token authentication.
      
      - **Key**: 
        - Refers to the identifier for the token, which is simply labeled as "token".
        
      - **Value**: 
        - The value for the token; it should be replaced with an actual bearer token, here represented as "BearerToken".
        
      - **Type**: 
        - Indicates the data type of the token value, specified as a string.

  - **Method**: 
    - The HTTP method that will be used to make the request. In this case, it is a GET request, which retrieves data from the server.

  - **URL**: 
    - The complete endpoint to access the API, which includes a placeholder for Query ID. The format is "http://localhost:3000/api/search/results/filter/?queryId=queryId".
    
    - **queryId**: 
      - This is a placeholder in the URL that should be replaced with the actual Query ID value when making the request.

  - **Headers**: 
    - An array of HTTP headers to be sent along with the request.

    - **Key**: 
      - This field is currently empty, indicating that no custom header keys are specified for this request.
      
    - **Value**: 
      - Similarly, this field is also empty, meaning there are no specific values for custom headers.
      
    - **Type**: 
      - The type of the header is default, meaning it does not follow any special format.
      
    - **Disabled**: 
      - Set to true, indicating that this header is not actively being sent with the request.

  - **Body**: 
    - Represents the body of the request, which is not utilized in a GET request.

    - **Mode**: 
      - The mode for the body is specified as raw, indicating raw data would typically be provided here if needed.
      
    - **Raw**: 
      - This field is empty, indicating that no raw data is included in this request body.

This detailed description provides context and clarification on the structure and components of the "Search - Results - By Query ID" endpoint for users utilizing the Postman API collection.

item.name: Search - Results - By Query ID and Filter ID

request.description:
This endpoint is used to retrieve search results based on a specific query ID and filter ID. Below are the details of each component involved in this request:

- **name**: The name of this endpoint is "Search - Results - By Query ID and Filter ID". This identifies the purpose of the API call.

- **request**: This section outlines the details of the API request being made.

  - **auth**: Specifies the authentication method required to access this endpoint.
  
    - **type**: The type of authentication used is "bearer", which means the request must include a bearer token for authorization.
    
    - **bearer**: An array containing the necessary authorization details.
    
      - **key**: The name of the token parameter required for the request.
      
      - **value**: A placeholder for the actual bearer token, represented as "BearerToken". This should be replaced with the appropriate token for the API user.
      
      - **type**: Indicates that the value should be treated as a string.
  
  - **method**: The HTTP method used for this request is "GET". This is typically used for retrieving data from the server.

  - **url**: This is the endpoint URL where the request is sent. It includes:
  
    - **base URL**: "http://localhost:3000/api/search/results/filter/" indicating the server address and path to the resource.
    
    - **queryId**: A placeholder for the query ID which is required to identify the specific search parameters used.
    
    - **filterId**: A placeholder for the filter ID that is applied to the search results. 
  
  - **headers**: This section contains the headers that can be sent with the request.
  
    - **key**: An empty field indicating that there are no custom headers being used in this request.
    
    - **value**: Corresponding value for the key is also empty as it is currently disabled.
    
    - **type**: Indicates the type of header, which is set to "default".
    
    - **disabled**: This indicates whether the header is active or inactive for this request. Here, it is set to true, meaning the header will not be sent.

  - **body**: This section describes the body of the request.
  
    - **mode**: Indicates the mode of the request body. It is set to "raw", meaning raw data is expected to be sent.
    
    - **raw**: This is an empty field indicating that no raw body data is included with the request.

This description should help users to understand how to utilize this endpoint effectively in their API calls.

item.name: Search - Results - By Query ID and Filter String

request.description:
### Description of the Endpoint Data

- **name**: The name of the endpoint is "Search - Results - By Query ID and Filter String." This indicates that the endpoint will be used to search for results based on a specific query ID and a filter string.

- **request**: This section contains all the details regarding the request that will be sent to the API.

  - **auth**: This part specifies the authentication method required for accessing the endpoint. 
    - **type**: The authentication type is "bearer," indicating that a token is needed to authenticate the request.
    - **bearer**: Here, an array of bearer tokens is specified. In this case:
      - **key**: This represents the name of the token field, which is labeled as "token."
      - **value**: This shows the value that needs to be sent in the request, marked as "BearerToken." Users will replace this placeholder with their actual token.
      - **type**: The type specifies that this value should be treated as a string.

  - **method**: This indicates the HTTP method to be used for the request, which is "GET." This method is typically used to retrieve data from the specified resource.

  - **url**: This is the URL endpoint where the request will be sent. It is structured as follows:
    - **http://localhost:3000/api/search/results/filter/**: The base URL for the API.
    - **?queryId=queryId**: This is a query parameter where users should input the specific ID related to the search query.
    - **&filter=channel**: This represents another query parameter where users can apply a filter, indicated here as "channel." Users can replace this with their desired filter string.

  - **headers**: This section contains any headers that will be included in the request.
    - In this instance, the key and value fields are empty, and the header is marked as disabled, indicating that no additional headers are currently in use for this request.

  - **body**: This part defines the body of the request.
    - **mode**: The mode is set to "raw," meaning the body will contain raw data.
    - **raw**: This field is empty, indicating that no additional data needs to be sent in the request body for this particular GET request. Users generally do not need to include a body for GET requests. 

This description provides a clear understanding of how to use the endpoint to search for results based on a query ID and filter string.

item.name: Search - Results - By Query String

request.description:
### Endpoint Description: Search - Results - By Query String

- **Name**: Search - Results - By Query String  
  This is the name of the API endpoint used for retrieving search results based on a specified query string.

- **Request**: This section outlines the characteristics of the request that will be sent to the API.

  - **Auth**: Authentication details for accessing the endpoint.
    - **Type**: bearer  
      Specifies that the authorization method used is the Bearer token.
    - **Bearer**: An array containing authentication details for the Bearer token.
      - **Key**: token  
        The identifier for the authentication token.
      - **Value**: BearerToken  
        A placeholder representing the actual token needed for authentication. This token must be provided to successfully access the API.
      - **Type**: string  
        Indicates that the token value should be in string format.

  - **Method**: GET  
    This signifies that the HTTP method used for the request is GET, which is typically used to retrieve data from the server.

  - **URL**: http://localhost:3000/api/search/results/filter/?query=nike  
    The endpoint's URL where the API request is directed. It specifies that the search results will be filtered based on the query parameter "query" with the value "nike."

  - **Headers**: Additional information sent along with the request.
    - **Key**: (empty string)  
      This field is currently unused and does not contain any specific header key.
    - **Value**: (empty string)  
      This field is currently unused and does not contain any specific header value.
    - **Type**: default  
      The default type for the header.
    - **Disabled**: true  
      Indicates that this header is currently disabled and will not be sent with the request.

  - **Body**: The content of the request.
    - **Mode**: raw  
      This indicates that the body will contain raw data.
    - **Raw**: ""  
      The body of the request is empty, meaning no additional data will be sent in the request body. 

This endpoint allows users to search for results by a query string, making it simple to filter results based on user input.

item.name: Search - Results - By Query String and Filter String

request.description:
### Endpoint Description: Search - Results - By Query String and Filter String

This endpoint allows users to perform a search operation based on a specified query string and filter criteria. Below is a detailed description of each data field involved in this API request.

#### Request Method
- **Method:** `GET`
  - This indicates that the request is retrieving data from the server. No data is being altered or created.

#### URL
- **URL:** `http://localhost:3000/api/search/results/filter/?query=Fortune&filter=channel`
  - This is the endpoint for accessing search results. 
  - It is currently set to search with the query "Fortune" and applies a filter based on the "channel" criteria. 

#### Authentication
- **Auth Type:** `Bearer`
  - The request requires a Bearer token for authentication. This type of authentication ensures that the user is verified before accessing the endpoint.

- **Bearer Token:**
  - **Key:** `token`
  - **Value:** `BearerToken`
  - **Type:** `string`
    - This is where you will replace "BearerToken" with your actual token. It provides the necessary credentials for accessing the API. 

#### Request Headers
- **Headers:** 
  - An empty header is provided in the template, which is disabled. You can add additional headers if necessary, such as Content-Type or Authorization, depending on your specific requirements for the request.

#### Body
- **Body:**
  - **Mode:** `raw`
  - **Raw Content:** `""`
    - The body is currently empty, which is typical for GET requests since they do not usually require a body. Additional parameters can be passed via the URL instead.

This endpoint is designed for searching and obtaining filtered results, making it useful for retrieving specific information based on the userâ€™s input. Make sure to replace the placeholder values as needed to successfully utilize the endpoint.

item.name: Search - Results - Get - By Username

request.description:
### Endpoint Description

**Name:** Search - Results - Get - By Username  
This endpoint is used to retrieve search results based on a specific username.

#### Request Details:

- **Auth:** 
  - **Type:** bearer 
    - This indicates that the request requires a bearer token for authentication. 
  - **Bearer Token:** 
    - **Key:** token 
      - The identifier for the token expected in the request.
    - **Value:** BearerToken 
      - This should be replaced with the actual bearer token for authorization.
    - **Type:** string 
      - Indicates that the token should be provided as a string.

- **Method:** 
  - **GET:** 
    - This indicates that the request method is GET, which is used to retrieve data from the server.

- **URL:** 
  - **Endpoint URL:** 
    - `http://localhost:3000/api/search/results/get/?username=fortunevieyra_`
      - This is the full URL where the request is sent. It includes the base URL and the query parameter. 
      - The `username` parameter in the query string specifies the username for which the search results will be fetched. In this instance, the username is set to `fortunevieyra_`.

- **Headers:** 
  - This section currently contains an empty header object.
    - **Key:** (no key specified) 
      - This indicates there are no custom headers being sent with the request.
    - **Value:** (no value specified) 
      - This indicates there is no corresponding value.
    - **Disabled:** true 
      - This indicates that any specified header is disabled and not included in the request.

- **Body:** 
  - **Mode:** raw 
    - Indicates that the body of the request is in raw format. 
  - **Raw:** 
    - This section is empty, meaning there is no request body sent with the GET request.

### Summary:
This API endpoint allows users to obtain search results using a specific username as a query parameter. Ensure to include a valid bearer token in the request for authentication purposes. The request method is GET, and there are no additional custom headers or body content needed for this request.

item.name: Search - Results - Get - By Tournament Name

request.description:
### API Endpoint Description

**Name:** Search - Results - Get - By Tournament Name

**Request Details:**

1. **Authentication:**
   - **Type:** Bearer
   - **Bearer Token:** This is a required token for authentication. It should be included in the request to verify the identity of the user. The format of the token is generally "Bearer [actual_token]". The placeholder used here is "BearerToken", which should be replaced with a valid token.

2. **Method:**
   - **GET:** This request uses the GET method, which is used to retrieve data from the specified resource without any side effects like altering data on the server. The request is made to fetch results related to a specific tournament.

3. **URL:**
   - **Endpoint URL:** The request is sent to `http://localhost:3000/api/search/results/all/?tournament=NikeAdidasTournament`. This URL specifies the endpoint for searching results. The parameter `tournament=NikeAdidasTournament` indicates that the search is filtered for results corresponding to the "NikeAdidasTournament".

4. **Headers:**
   - **Header 1:** There are currently no custom headers set as the key and value fields are empty, and the header is disabled. This means no additional headers are added to the request.

5. **Body:**
   - **Mode:** The body mode is set to "raw", but since this request does not send any data, the raw field is empty. This indicates that there is no need to send any body content for this GET request.

### Summary

This endpoint is designed to retrieve search results filtered by the specified tournament name. Proper authentication is required, with a bearer token needed to access the data. The query is made explicitly to gather information on the "NikeAdidasTournament" results. No additional headers or body data are necessary for this request.

**Description:** This endpoint retrieves all search results specifically related to teams.

  - This requires a token string for authentication purposes.
    - **Key**: `token`
    - **Value**: `BearerToken` (Replace this with your actual token)

- **Method**: 
  - **GET** - This indicates that the request is fetching data from the server.

- **URL**: 
  - `http://localhost:3000/api/search/results/all/?find=teams&accountId=accountId`
    - This is the endpoint URL where the request is sent.
    - **Query Parameters**:
      - **find**: Specifies that the search is focused on teams.
      - **accountId**: This needs to be replaced with the actual account ID you want to search results for.

- **Headers**: 
  - Currently, there are no headers set (the key and value fields are empty and the header is disabled).

- **Body**: 
  - **Mode**: Raw
  - Since this is a GET request, the body is empty, indicating that no additional data is sent with the request.

### Summary:
This endpoint is designed to fetch all teams based on the provided account ID. Make sure to replace `BearerToken` with a valid bearer token for authentication and `accountId` with the specific account ID required for your search. The request does not include any headers or additional body content.

item.name: Search - Results - Get All - Teams By Search

request.description:
### Endpoint: Search - Results - Get All - Teams By Search

**Name:**
- The name of this endpoint is "Search - Results - Get All - Teams By Search". This indicates that the endpoint is used for retrieving all teams based on a search query.

**Request:**

- **Auth:**
  - **Type:** The authorization method used for this API request is Bearer token authentication. This means that a token is required to access the endpoint.
  - **Bearer:** This section contains the details about the bearer token.
    - **Key:** This field denotes the name of the token, which is specified as "token".
    - **Value:** The placeholder value is "BearerToken". This should be replaced with the actual bearer token when making the request.
    - **Type:** The type of the value is specified as "string", meaning the token should be provided as a string.

- **Method:**
  - The HTTP method for this request is "GET". This indicates that data is being retrieved from the server rather than sent or modified.

- **URL:**
  - The request is made to the following URL: `http://localhost:3000/api/search/results/all/?find=teams&accountId=accountId&team=nike`.
  - **Base URL:** `http://localhost:3000/api/search/results/all/` is the endpoint where the request is directed.
  - **Query Parameters:**
    - **find:** This parameter is set to "teams", indicating that the search is specifically for teams.
    - **accountId:** This is a placeholder for the actual account ID. It should be filled in with the specific account identifier relevant to the search.
    - **team:** This parameter is set to "nike". It specifies that the search should include the team named Nike.

- **Headers:**
  - This section currently contains an entry where both the key and value are empty. The type is "default" and this header is marked as disabled. This means that no custom headers are being sent with this request.

- **Body:**
  - **Mode:** The mode of the body is set to "raw".
  - **Raw:** The body content is empty. Since this is a GET request, typically, no body is included in the request.

This endpoint is designed for users to fetch teams related to a specific search criteria by providing necessary parameters such as account ID and the team name they are looking for. It requires a valid bearer token for authentication to ensure that the request is authorized.

item.name: Search - Results - Get All - Tournaments

- **name**: This is the title of the API endpoint, indicating its purpose. In this case, it is used to retrieve all tournament results from the search functionality.

- **request**: This section contains all the details necessary to make the API request.

  - **auth**: This field specifies the authentication method required for the request.
    - **type**: This indicates the type of authentication being used. Here it is "bearer," which means the request will require a Bearer token.
    - **bearer**: This is an array of objects specifying the token necessary for authentication.
      - **key**: This is the field name for the token.
      - **value**: This contains the actual Bearer token. The example shows "BearerToken," which should be replaced with a valid token when making the request.
      - **type**: This indicates the data type of the value; in this case, it is a string.

  - **method**: The HTTP method used for the request. This is set to "GET," which means the request is intended to retrieve data from the server.

  - **url**: The endpoint URL that will be requested. This example points to a local server's search results API for tournaments. It includes query parameters for finding tournaments and an account ID.
    - **find**: This query parameter is set to "tournaments," indicating that the request is specifically looking for tournament results.
    - **accountId**: This query parameter requires the user to provide an account ID. It is used to filter results associated with a specific account.

  - **headers**: An array of HTTP headers for the request. In this case, it is empty as there are no additional headers needed for this request.
    - **key**: The header field name, which is not provided here.

item.name: Search - Results - Get All - Tournaments By Search

request.description:
### Search - Results - Get All - Tournaments By Search

This API endpoint retrieves all tournament results based on a specified search query. Below is a detailed description of the information for each data element in this request.

- **name**: The title of the API request. It indicates that this endpoint is used to search for and retrieve tournament results based on user-defined criteria.

- **request**: This section outlines the details of the HTTP request that will be sent to the server.

  - **auth**: This specifies the authentication method required to access the API. In this case, it uses a Bearer Token for authorization.
  
    - **type**: Indicates that the authentication type is a Bearer token.

    - **bearer**: This is an array containing the details needed for the Bearer token.
    
      - **key**: The key identifying the type of authentication.
      
      - **value**: This should be replaced with the actual Bearer token value that is used for authentication.
      
      - **type**: States the format of the token, which is a string in this context.

  - **method**: The HTTP method for this request, which is "GET". This means the request will retrieve data without making any alterations to it.

  - **url**: The endpoint URL to which the request is sent. This includes query parameters for the search:
    
    - **find=tournaments**: This parameter indicates that the search should focus on tournaments.
    
    - **accountId=accountId**: This parameter should be replaced with the actual account ID being queried. It is used to filter the results based on the user's account.
    
    - **tournament=nikevsadidas**: This parameter specifies the name of the tournament being searched for. Replace this with the relevant tournament name when making the request.

  - **headers**: Contains additional information to be sent with the request. 

    - **key**: There is no key provided for headers in this case, which means no additional headers are required.
    
    - **value**: No value is specified, indicating that no additional header values are necessary.
    
    - **type**: Default indicates the type of header, though it's not used here as the header is disabled.
    
    - **disabled**: Set to true, indicating that this header will not be included in the request.

  - **body**: This section does not contain any body content, as this is a GET request. 

    - **mode**: Indicates the mode of the body; it's set to "raw".
    
    - **raw**: No raw data is provided since GET requests typically do not require a body. 

Overall, this endpoint is designed for searching and retrieving detailed information about tournaments based on various parameters, ensuring that the user can effectively filter and access the relevant tournament data.

- **name**: This is the title of the request within the API collection. It identifies the request for retrieving all message search results.

- **request**: This object contains the details necessary to perform the API request.

  - **auth**: Specifies the authentication method required for this request.
  
    - **type**: The authentication type being used; in this case, it is a Bearer token.

    - **bearer**: An array that includes the details of the bearer token to be used for authentication.

      - **key**: This represents the label for the token parameter. It is set as "token".

      - **value**: This holds the actual bearer token required for authentication. In this example, it is labeled as "BearerToken" but should be replaced with a valid token.

      - **type**: The type of the bearer token, which is specified as "string".

  - **method**: The HTTP method used for the request. Here, it is set to "GET," indicating that the request will retrieve data.

  - **url**: The endpoint URL where the request is sent. It consists of the base URL (http://localhost:3000) along with the path (/api/search/results/all/) and query parameters which include:
  
    - `find=messages`: This parameter specifies that the search is focused on messages.
    
    - `accountId=accountId`: This parameter is likely intended to filter the results based on a specific account. The placeholder "accountId" should be replaced with an actual account ID.

  - **headers**: A collection of headers to include in the request. In this case, there is a single key-value pair that is currently disabled and does not have a specified key or value. This can be used to add any required headers upon enabling.

  - **body**: This section provides information about the request body.
  
    - **mode**: The mode is set to "raw", indicating that the body content is not structured in a specific format (like JSON).
    
    - **raw**: The content of the request body is empty in this case, meaning no data will be sent in the body of the request. 

### Summary

This endpoint is intended for fetching all message results related to a specific account, using Bearer token authentication in a GET request format. Make sure to replace the placeholders with actual values for successful execution.

item.name: Search - Results - Get All - Messages By Search

request.description:
### Endpoint Description: Search - Results - Get All - Messages By Search

**Name**: Search - Results - Get All - Messages By Search  
This endpoint retrieves messages based on specific search parameters from the server that handles messaging data.

---

#### Request Details:

- **Authentication**:  
  - Type: Bearer Token  
    - This endpoint requires authentication via a bearer token. The token should be included in the request header to access the endpoint.

- **Method**:  
  - GET  
    - This request uses the GET method to retrieve data. No changes will be made to the server's data, and the request is used solely for fetching information.

- **URL**:  
  - `http://localhost:3000/api/search/results/all/?find=channels&accountId=accountId&message=abc`  
    - This is the URL to which the GET request will be sent. It includes query parameters that specify the details of the search.

#### Query Parameters:

- **find**:  
  - This parameter specifies the type of search to perform. In this case, it is set to "channels", indicating that the search results will be filtered to channels.

- **accountId**:  
  - This parameter is used to specify the unique identifier for the account associated with the messages being searched. It allows the request to query only relevant messages for that specific account.

- **message**:  
  - This parameter contains the search term "abc", indicating that the search will look for messages that contain this specific text string.

---

#### Headers:

- **Headers**:  
  - Currently, there are no custom headers being sent with this request as indicated by the empty key and value. A default header is present but disabled; therefore, it does not influence the request.

---

#### Body:

- **Body**:  
  - Mode: Raw  
    - The body of the request is empty, as GET requests typically do not include a body. Any information required for processing the request should be included in the URL as query parameters.

---

This endpoint is useful for dynamically searching for messages within different channels based on the specified criteria. Ensure that the bearer token is valid for authentication.

**Endpoint Name:**  
Search - Results - Get All - By Tournament Name  
This endpoint is used to retrieve search results for a specific tournament based on its name.

**Request Method:**  
GET  
This method is used to request data from the specified resource without modifying it.

**Request URL:**  
http://localhost:3000/api/search/results/all/?tournament=NikeAdidasTournament&find=all  
This URL points to the API where the search request is made. The query parameters include:
- `tournament`: Specifies the name of the tournament for which results are being searched. In this case, the tournament is "NikeAdidasTournament."
- `find`: Indicates the type of search to perform. The value "all" suggests that the request aims to retrieve all relevant results related to the specified tournament.

**Authorization:**  
- **Auth Type:** Bearer  
The authorization method used here is bearer token authentication. This requires providing a token in the request header to authenticate the user.

- **Bearer Token:**  
  - **Key:** token  
    This is the key used for the bearer token in the request header.
  - **Value:** BearerToken  
    This is a placeholder value that should be replaced with an actual bearer token. The bearer token is a string that provides access to protected resources in the API.
  - **Type:** string  
    This indicates that the value for the bearer token is of type string.

**Headers:**  
- The headers section currently contains an entry with empty key and value fields. However, it is marked as "disabled," meaning no additional headers are included in the request at this time.

**Body:**  
- **Mode:** raw  
The request body mode is set to "raw," indicating that the request does not contain any data payload beyond the query parameters in the URL.
- **Raw:**  
  No content is included in the raw body of the request, which is typical for a GET request since data is usually sent through query parameters.

This documentation should help users understand how to use this endpoint and what parameters are required for a successful API call.

      - Indicates that the bearer token is treated as a string.

- **Method:**  
  - **GET**
    - This method is used to retrieve data from the specified resource.

- **URL:**  
  - `http://localhost:3000/api/search/results/all/?username=fortunevieyra_&find=teams`
    - This is the endpoint used to search for teams based on a specific username. 
    - The query parameters:
      - **username=fortunevieyra_**
        - The username to search for teams associated with. In this example, it is set to "fortunevieyra_".
      - **find=teams**
        - Specifies that the search should return results related to teams.

- **Headers:**
  - This section is currently empty and disabled.
    - You may not need to provide any additional headers for this request. If required in the future, you can enable and specify the headers here.

- **Body:**
  - **Mode:** raw
    - This indicates that the body of the request is in raw format.
  - **Raw:** 
    - The body is currently empty as this is a GET request, which typically does not send a body.

**Summary:**  
This endpoint allows users to search for teams associated with a specific username by sending a GET request with a bearer token for authentication. The response will provide details of the teams found for the provided username. Use the specified URL and replace the bearer token with a valid one for successful access.

### Endpoint Description: Search - Results - Get Tournaments - By Username

**Request Type:** GET  
This endpoint is used to retrieve tournament results associated with a specific username.

**URL:** 
`http://localhost:3000/api/search/results/all/?username=fortunevieyra_&find=tournaments`

- The query parameters included in the URL are:

  - `find=tournaments`: This indicates that the search is specifically for tournaments.

**Authorization:** 
- **Type:** Bearer

**Bearer Token Details:**
- **Key:** token  
- The parameter name for the token.
- **Value:** BearerToken  
- This would be replaced with the actual bearer token used for authentication.

### Summary:
This endpoint is designed to retrieve tournament data based on a provided username. It requires authentication via a Bearer token and does not require any request body or additional headers.

item.name: Search - Results - Get Tournaments - By Team Name

request.description:
### Endpoint Description: Search - Results - Get Tournaments - By Team Name

**Endpoint Name**: This endpoint is used to search for tournaments by a specific team name.

**Request Type**: 
- **Method**: `GET` 
  - This indicates that the request will retrieve data from the server and will not modify any resources.

**Authorization**:
- **Auth Type**: `Bearer`
  - This type of authentication requires a bearer token to be included in the request for access to the endpoint.
  - **Token Structure**:
    - **Key**: "token" 
      - This is the name of the header that carries the authorization token.
    - **Value**: "BearerToken" 
      - This placeholder represents the actual bearer token needed for authentication. Users should replace this with their valid token.
    - **Type**: "string" 
      - This indicates that the token value is a string.

**URL**: 
- `http://localhost:3000/api/search/results/all/?team=NikeShoes&find=tournaments`
  - This is the request URL used to access the endpoint. 
  - Query parameters explained:
    - **team=NikeShoes**: This parameter specifies the name of the team whose tournaments are being searched. In this case, the team name is "NikeShoes".
    - **find=tournaments**: This parameter indicates that the search is specifically looking for tournaments associated with the specified team.

**Headers**: 
- The header section currently shows an empty key and value pair and is marked as disabled.
  - This means no additional headers are being sent with the request. Users can add custom headers if needed.

**Body**:
- **Mode**: `raw`
  - Indicates that the body of the request doesnâ€™t contain any data since it's a GET request.
- **Raw**: 
  - The raw data section is empty, which is expected for a GET request as the parameters needed are included in the URL.

### Summary
This endpoint allows users to retrieve a list of tournaments by providing the specific team name in the query parameters, all while ensuring security through bearer token authentication. No additional headers or body content are required for the GET request.
